common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Failure
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch or getting stuck during startup, particularly on versions 11.1.0 and 11.1.1. This was attributed to data migration issues, conflicting software, and stricter hardware requirements. Solutions included reinstalling the app, updating to the latest version (11.1.2), and removing conflicting software data.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS takes a while to boot up 

**Key Points:**

* **Problem:** PiecesOS is stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab and doesn't progress.
* **Affected Platforms:** Windows and macOS.
* **Impacted User:** Shamas Habib and rogierlegit.
* **Potential Causes:**
    * Major data migration during 11.1.0 update.
    * Conflicting software - Atlas OS in Shamas' case, OneDrive in Jason's case.
    * macOS specific issue for rogierlegit, potentially related to PFD.

**Solutions Implemented:**

* **Windows:**
    * Reinstalling PiecesOS with the appInstaller build.
    * Uninstalling and reinstalling the latest version (11.1.1).
    * Checking for and removing conflicting software data (OneDrive files in Documents folder).
* **macOS:**
    * Restarting the application.
    * Waiting for patch 3.3.8 of the desktop app.

**Current Status:**

* Shamas and Jason's issues are resolved.
* rogierlegit's issue is partially resolved with the workaround.

**Outcome:**

* The PiecesOS team identified and addressed various causes of the issue.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version and follow instructions in case the problem persists.
* Further improvements are expected with the upcoming patch for macOS.

## Additional Information:

* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed logs and screenshots for troubleshooting.
* It also demonstrates the value of clear communication between users and the support team.
* This summary can be helpful for future reference and troubleshooting similar issues.

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @C2mokete reported an issue with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up.
* The user mentioned they were unable to get past the "ensure core dependency" stage in the Desktop application.
* The support bot suggested related issues and resources for troubleshooting.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was taking an unusually long time to boot up.
* The user was stuck at the "ensure core dependency" stage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The support team suggested a new release of PiecesOS (11.1.2) as a potential fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed by the support team, assuming the problem was resolved with the new release.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user did not confirm whether the issue was resolved with the new release.
* If the problem persists, the user can reopen the issue for further assistance.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Conversation Summary:

**Key points:**

* Users reported being unable to launch Pieces OS.
* The issue was related to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.
* Support suggested providing logs for further investigation.
* A fix was planned for release within 24-48 hours.
* Users were encouraged to update to version 11.1.2 for resolution.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS wouldn't launch for some users.
* Hardware requirements in version 11.1.1 were too strict.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Provide logs to support for investigation.
* Release a patch with relaxed hardware requirements (version 11.1.2).

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* The issue was closed after confirmation from the user.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation involved multiple users and support personnel.
* The issue was acknowledged and addressed promptly by the Pieces team.
* The user expressed satisfaction with the resolution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a hardware incompatibility related to missing AVX2 support in older CPUs. The Pieces team acknowledged the problem and released version 11.1.2, which includes a fix to address the AVX2 dependency and ensure broader compatibility.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

### Key Points Raised:

* User @GetReal444 was experiencing issues booting up the PiecesOS application.
* The issue appeared to be related to a hardware requirement on the database service.
* This issue was potentially affecting multiple users.

### Problems Identified:

* The user was unable to launch PiecesOS due to an error related to the database service.
* The error was caused by a missing hardware requirement (AVX2 support).

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* The Pieces team investigated the issue and identified it as a widespread problem.
* They proposed a solution involving updating the database service to remove the AVX2 dependency.
* A patch was implemented and released in the 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The issue has been resolved with the release of PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
* The user confirmed that the application is now working properly.

### Additional Notes:

* The team provided helpful resources and support to the user throughout the process.
* The issue was resolved in a timely manner.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @gonzososa reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on their system.
* @pieces-support-bot acknowledged the issue and provided helpful resources.
* @tsavo-at-pieces explained the issue is related to AVX2 compatibility on their system.
* @hra42 provided further explanation of the AVX2 requirement.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requested information about the user's CPU.
* @gonzososa provided information about their CPU (Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M).
* @mark-at-pieces announced the release of version 11.1.2 with a fix for the AVX2 issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS not launching on user's system due to lack of AVX2 support.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Releasing a new version (11.1.2) with AVX2 compatibility check and alternative solution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is fixed with the release of version 11.1.2.
* @gonzososa confirmed that the fix works for them.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue is related to another issue reported in #620. 
* CPUs released before 2016/2017 may not be compatible with Pieces due to AVX2 requirement.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Connectivity and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to connect to cloud services or utilize local LLMs. This might be due to firewall restrictions, network configuration, or stricter hardware requirements in recent versions. Solutions include checking network settings, providing logs for diagnosis, and updating to the latest version (11.1.2).

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User rohanrathi99 is experiencing issues with PiecesOS, specifically:
    * Difficulty making requests to Pieces cloud services.
    * Problems with local models.
* The issue might be caused by a firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking PiecesOS outgoing requests.
* Difficulty diagnosing the exact cause of the issue without additional information.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested the user to provide logs for com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd.
* Rohanrathi99 uploaded the requested logs to Google Drive and shared the link with mark-at-pieces.
* Mark-at-pieces requested access to the files via email.
* Rohanrathi99 granted access to mark-at-pieces.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Mark-at-pieces has access to the logs and will likely analyze them to diagnose the issue. 
* The issue remains unresolved until further investigation. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place between February 16th and 21st, 2025.
* The user expressed their appreciation for the support received.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* @AmanSingh766 is experiencing an exception when trying to download local LLMs. 
* The error message is: "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress".

**Problems Identified:**

* The user is unable to download local LLMs.
* The cause of the error is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces requests support logs and information about the frequency of the error.
* It is suggested that the issue might be resolved in version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not provided an update since February 17th, 2025.
* It is unclear if the issue has been resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue conversation is related to the Pieces Copilot Service.
* There are several other open issues with the same error message.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on Windows and macOS, often stuck at "ensure core dependency" stage. The issue seems to be related to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1.  Updating to version 11.1.2, which relaxed hardware requirements, resolved the issue for most users. Providing logs to support can help diagnose persistent issues.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

## GitHub Issue Summary: Unresponsive Pieces App

**Key Points:**

* @Rohit0072 reported that the Pieces app is unresponsive, encountering issues during booting.
* Pieces Support Bot categorized the issue and provided related issues and resources.
* @mark-at-pieces and @tsavo-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and investigated.
* @tsavo-at-pieces identified a potential fix and planned a release within the next day. 

**Solutions:**

* Update to the latest 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS as suggested by @mark-at-pieces.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is marked as closed on February 17th, 2025.
* If the issue persists, @Rohit0072 is advised to reopen it.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unresponsive Pieces app during booting.
* Related to other reported issues (#620, #624, and #625).

**Outcome:**

* A potential fix was identified and released in PiecesOS version 11.1.2. 
* Users are advised to update to resolve the issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch failures:** Focus on addressing the root causes of boot-up failures and AVX2 incompatibility to ensure a smoother user experience, especially after updates.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** Clearly communicate minimum hardware requirements for PiecesOS, particularly AVX2 support, to prevent installation issues and frustration for users with older CPUs.
**Investigate and address connectivity issues:** Analyze logs and diagnose the root causes of cloud service and local LLM connection problems to ensure stable and reliable functionality.

**Enhance support resources for network configuration:** Provide clear and detailed instructions on firewall settings and network configurations to help users resolve connectivity issues independently.
**Proactively monitor error trends:** Implement a system to track and analyze error messages and crash reports to identify recurring issues and prioritize fixes in future releases.
**Improve sign-in process:** Investigate and resolve issues with Google and GitHub account connections to ensure a seamless sign-in experience for users.

**Gather detailed logs for persistent issues:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system information for unresolved issues to facilitate faster diagnosis and resolution by the support team.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for PiecesOS:**  Given the technical nature of PiecesOS issues, a dedicated support channel or forum could help streamline troubleshooting and knowledge sharing.

**Develop a system for early detection of hardware incompatibility:** Implement checks during installation or update processes to identify potential hardware incompatibilities and alert users before proceeding.
**Improve documentation and FAQs:** Update support documentation and FAQs to include common troubleshooting steps for launch failures, connectivity issues, and sign-in problems.
